page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY.
page.content: It is worthy of mention that in recent years the use of{aerial photography has made it possible to distinguish clearly the{lay-out of a Roman Camp which covered the{area lying between {the Parish Church and the school. Since the excavation of part of this setting, the name{"Stracathro Camp" has been given to a certain category of{Roman marching camps. A Glasgow merchant, Charles Hutcheson, being an amateur musician, composed the{Psalm tune, "Stracathro",}in honour of his connection with the Campbell family of Stracathro. {A Nobel Prize Winner of 1949, Lord {Boyd-Orr of Brechin,}had very strong links with the area and his family take a very close interest in its welfare. An acknowledged world authority on the{correct use of land, he was also Chancellor of Glasgow Univ
